instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black spots left side only
threads.message:
Hey all. <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

History: waterdamaged

- ultrasonic cleaned
- inspected under micro scope

everything seems ok but i have a problem with lcd backlight. it seems to have waves/black spots. it only come half way on the lower left. Is it possible to fix?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black spots left side only
threads.message: Check LED returns on the LCD connector and their corresponding resistors and traces for continuity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black spots left side only
threads.message: No need to check the resistors, just diode mode all the LED return pins on the LCD connector. They should all read the same. Could be corroded connector/resistor/trace or <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black spots left side only
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 30433"]No need to check the resistors, just diode mode all the LED return pins on the LCD connector. They should all read the same. Could be corroded connector/resistor/trace or <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>.[/QUOTE]

i measured all 6 pins they are all around 626~631

no sign of corrosion - water was more on the top side of board + the other end so i suspect it would be <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>.
I will replace and report back.

Thanks for your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black spots left side only
threads.message: No use in replacing it if diode mode reads ok. Tried a known good LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black spots left side only
threads.message: disaster. changed <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> now no power. i will replace another one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black spots left side only
threads.message: cry me a river. had <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> mounted upside down. soldered it right way now boots but no blacklight? wonder why? :rolleyes: :D:D:D
